articles.headline: Reckoning in Irish Court for a Tycoon in Disgrace
articles.snippet: An Irish court has set Friday as the deadline for Sean Quinn to provide information on what the Irish government contends is his byzantine collection of offshore assets and opaque owners.
articles.abstract: An Irish court has set Friday as the deadline for Sean Quinn to provide information on what the Irish government contends is his byzantine collection of offshore assets and opaque owners.
articles.lead_paragraph: DERRYLIN, Northern Ireland — It is only a short distance, but a vast world apart. The stately brick-and-glass headquarters that was once Sean Quinn’s realm is only a six-minute drive from the cinder block bunker where Mr. Quinn, a bankrupt former billionaire, is now making what could be his last stand.

articles.headline: Roberts Leaves ‘Good Morning America’ for Medical Treatment
articles.snippet: Robin Roberts, who will undergo a bone marrow transplant that will leave her hospitalized and homebound for months, began her leave of absence a day early.
articles.abstract: Robin Roberts, who will undergo a bone marrow transplant that will leave her hospitalized and homebound for months, began her leave of absence a day early.
articles.lead_paragraph: Starting Friday, ABC’s “Good Morning America” — which has surged ahead of the “Today” show in recent weeks to become the No. 1 morning television show in America — will be without its biggest star, Robin Roberts.

articles.headline: Majority of New Jobs Pay Low Wages, Study Finds
articles.snippet: The disappearance of midwage, midskill jobs is part of a longer-term trend that some refer to as a hollowing out of the American work force.
articles.abstract: The disappearance of midwage, midskill jobs is part of a longer-term trend that some refer to as a hollowing out of the American work force.
articles.lead_paragraph: While a majority of jobs lost during the downturn were in the middle range of wages, a majority of those added during the recovery have been low paying, according to a new report from the National Employment Law Project.

articles.headline: Software Meant to Fight Crime Is Used to Spy on Dissidents
articles.snippet: Two researchers say an off-the-shelf computer program has been used to monitor and spy on dissidents in countries around the world.
articles.abstract: Two researchers say an off-the-shelf computer program has been used to monitor and spy on dissidents in countries around the world.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Morgan Marquis-Boire works as a Google engineer and Bill Marczak is earning a Ph.D. in computer science. But this summer, the two men have been moonlighting as detectives, chasing an elusive surveillance tool from Bahrain across five continents.

articles.headline: No Charges Filed on Harsh Tactics Used by the C.I.A.
articles.snippet: Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr.’s announcement on Thursday eliminates the last possibility that any criminal charges will result from brutal interrogations carried out by the C.I.A.
articles.abstract: Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr.’s announcement on Thursday eliminates the last possibility that any criminal charges will result from brutal interrogations carried out by the C.I.A.
articles.lead_paragraph: Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. announced Thursday that no one would be prosecuted for the deaths of a prisoner in Afghanistan in 2002 and another in Iraq in 2003, eliminating the last possibility that any criminal charges will be brought as a result of the brutal interrogations carried out by the C.I.A.

articles.headline: Tata Motors Finds Success in Jaguar Land Rover
articles.snippet: Analysts say Tata Motors, which bought Jaguar Land Rover four years ago, has done what few companies from emerging markets have been able to do — turn around a troubled Western company.
articles.abstract: Analysts say Tata Motors, which bought Jaguar Land Rover four years ago, has done what few companies from emerging markets have been able to do — turn around a troubled Western company.
articles.lead_paragraph: MUMBAI, India — This summer, Jaguar Land Rover cranked up production to 24 hours at its plant near Liverpool, England, adding 1,000 jobs to help meet demand for its hot-selling and acclaimed Range Rover Evoque. Now, the company is readying the release of its much-anticipated Jaguar F-Type roadster.

articles.headline: Emotional Ties to Obama May Be Central to the Election
articles.snippet: The challenge for Mitt Romney may be that even Americans who are unhappy with President Obama remain personally attached to him.
articles.abstract: The challenge for Mitt Romney may be that even Americans who are unhappy with President Obama remain personally attached to him.
articles.lead_paragraph: TAMPA, Fla. — Through three nights of gauzy videos, sentimental testimonials and, finally, his own address to the nation Thursday, Mitt Romney worked hard to show he has a heart.

articles.headline: Romney Vows to Deliver Country From Economic Travails
articles.snippet: Mitt Romney asked voters to consider whether their lives had improved over the last four years and urged them not to feel guilty about giving up on President Obama.
articles.abstract: Mitt Romney asked voters to consider whether their lives had improved over the last four years and urged them not to feel guilty about giving up on President Obama.
articles.lead_paragraph: TAMPA, Fla. — Mitt Romney accepted the Republican presidential nomination on Thursday by making a direct appeal to Americans who were captivated by President Obama’s hopeful promises of change, pledging that he could deliver what the president did not and move the country from its worst economic downturn since the Great Depression.

articles.headline: Report on Iran Nuclear Work Puts Israel in a Box
articles.snippet: An International Atomic Energy Agency report detailing Iran’s ramped up nuclear capabilities may force Israel to strike Iran or concede it cannot act on its own, according to experts.
articles.abstract: An International Atomic Energy Agency report detailing Iran’s ramped up nuclear capabilities may force Israel to strike Iran or concede it cannot act on its own, according to experts.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — For Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, the International Atomic Energy Agency on Thursday offered findings validating his longstanding position that while harsh economic sanctions and diplomatic isolation may have hurt Iran, they have failed to slow Tehran’s nuclear program. If anything, the program is speeding up.
articles.byline: By Jodi Rudoren and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: Tokyo Court Hands Win to Samsung Over Apple
articles.snippet: A Tokyo court ruled Friday that Samsung’s mobile products did not infringe on Apple’s patents.
articles.abstract: A Tokyo court ruled Friday that Samsung’s mobile products did not infringe on Apple’s patents.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — A Japanese court on Friday rejected patent claims made by Apple against Samsung, a victory for the company after its crushing defeat in the United States last week and a reminder of the global scope of the patent war between the two technology giants.
articles.byline: By Hiroko Tabuchi and Nick Wingfield

articles.headline: Overpriced Real Estate? Well, Maybe It’s Art
articles.snippet: Sales prices in Manhattan for luxury residences are climbing toward $100 million, and some say it’s because buyers are looking at the properties as art.
articles.abstract: Sales prices in Manhattan for luxury residences are climbing toward $100 million, and some say it’s because buyers are looking at the properties as art.
articles.lead_paragraph: If it’s $100 million, is it art?

articles.headline: Fed Chairman Makes Case, in Strong Terms, for New Action
articles.snippet: Ben S. Bernanke, the head of the Federal Reserve, called the unemployment rate a “grave concern,” reinforcing signs that the Fed would take further steps to stimulate growth.
articles.abstract: Ben S. Bernanke, the head of the Federal Reserve, called the unemployment rate a “grave concern,” reinforcing signs that the Fed would take further steps to stimulate growth.
articles.lead_paragraph: JACKSON HOLE, Wyo. — The Federal Reserve chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, delivered a detailed and forceful argument on Friday for new steps to stimulate the economy, reinforcing earlier indications that the Fed is on the verge of action.

articles.headline: Last Plea on School Loans: Proving a Hopeless Future
articles.snippet: To discharge student loans in bankruptcy, a borrower may have to convince a judge that life will never get better and destitution is certain.
articles.abstract: To discharge student loans in bankruptcy, a borrower may have to convince a judge that life will never get better and destitution is certain.
articles.lead_paragraph: PLAIN CITY, Ohio — It isn’t easy to stand up in an open courtroom and bear witness to the abject wretchedness of your financial situation, but by the time Doug Wallace Jr. was 31 years old, he had little to lose by trying.
